WebkitBoxFlex.description:
The **`-moz-box-flex`** and **`-webkit-box-flex`** CSS properties specify how a `-moz-box` or `-webkit-box` grows to fill the box that contains it, in the direction of the containing box's layout.

**Syntax**: `<number>`

**Initial value**: `0`

WebkitBoxFlexGroup.description:
The **`box-flex-group`** CSS property assigns the flexbox's child elements to a flex group.

**Syntax**: `<integer>`

**Initial value**: `1`

WebkitBoxLines.description:
The **`box-lines`** CSS property determines whether the box may have a single or multiple lines (rows for horizontally oriented boxes, columns for vertically oriented boxes).

**Syntax**: `single | multiple`

**Initial value**: `single`

WebkitBoxOrdinalGroup.description:
The **`box-ordinal-group`** CSS property assigns the flexbox's child elements to an ordinal group.

**Syntax**: `<integer>`

**Initial value**: `1`

WebkitBoxOrient.description:
The **`box-orient`** CSS property sets whether an element lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

**Syntax**: `horizontal | vertical | inline-axis | block-axis | inherit`

**Initial value**: `inline-axis` (`horizontal` in XUL)

WebkitBoxPack.description:
The **`-moz-box-pack`** and **`-webkit-box-pack`** CSS properties specify how a `-moz-box` or `-webkit-box` packs its contents in the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

**Syntax**: `start | center | end | justify`

**Initial value**: `start`

WebkitScrollSnapPointsX.description:
The **`scroll-snap-points-x`** CSS property defines the horizontal positioning of snap points within the content of the scroll container they are applied to.

**Syntax**: `none | repeat( <length-percentage> )`

**Initial value**: `none`

WebkitScrollSnapPointsY.description:
The **`scroll-snap-points-y`** CSS property defines the vertical positioning of snap points within the content of the scroll container they are applied to.

**Syntax**: `none | repeat( <length-percentage> )`

**Initial value**: `none`

HTMLDivElement.description: Provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating <div> elements.

attributes.description: A collection of Attr objects. Objects inside a NamedNodeMap are not in any particular order, unlike NodeList, although they may be accessed by an index as in an array.

classList.description: Allows for manipulation of element's class content attribute as a set of whitespace-separated tokens through a DOMTokenList object.

className.description: Returns the value of element's class content attribute. Can be set to change it.

id.description: Returns the value of element's id content attribute. Can be set to change it.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

shadowRoot.description: Returns element's shadow root, if any, and if shadow root's mode is "open", and null otherwise.

slot.description: Returns the value of element's slot content attribute. Can be set to change it.

baseURI.description: Returns node's node document's document base URL.

isConnected.description: Returns true if node is connected and false otherwise.

nodeName.description: Returns a string appropriate for the type of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINED_BY.description: Set when other is a descendant of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINS.description: Set when other is an ancestor of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

nextElementSibling.description: Returns the first following sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

previousElementSibling.description: Returns the first preceding sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

firstElementChild.description: Returns the first child that is an element, and null otherwise.

lastElementChild.description: Returns the last child that is an element, and null otherwise.

style.description: An object that is a CSS declaration block, and exposes style information and various style-related methods and properties.

onabort.description: Fires when the user aborts the download.

onblur.description: Fires when the object loses the input focus.

oncanplay.description: Occurs when playback is possible, but would require further buffering.

onchange.description: Fires when the contents of the object or selection have changed.

onclick.description: Fires when the user clicks the left mouse button on the object

oncontextmenu.description: Fires when the user clicks the right mouse button in the client area, opening the context menu.

ondblclick.description: Fires when the user double-clicks the object.

ondrag.description: Fires on the source object continuously during a drag operation.

ondragend.description: Fires on the source object when the user releases the mouse at the close of a drag operation.

ondragenter.description: Fires on the target element when the user drags the object to a valid drop target.

ondragleave.description: Fires on the target object when the user moves the mouse out of a valid drop target during a drag operation.

ondragover.description: Fires on the target element continuously while the user drags the object over a valid drop target.

ondragstart.description: Fires on the source object when the user starts to drag a text selection or selected object.

ondurationchange.description: Occurs when the duration attribute is updated.

onemptied.description: Occurs when the media element is reset to its initial state.

onended.description: Occurs when the end of playback is reached.

onerror.description: Fires when an error occurs during object loading.

onfocus.description: Fires when the object receives focus.

onkeydown.description: Fires when the user presses a key.

onkeypress.description: Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key.

onkeyup.description: Fires when the user releases a key.

onload.description: Fires immediately after the browser loads the object.

onloadeddata.description: Occurs when media data is loaded at the current playback position.

onloadedmetadata.description: Occurs when the duration and dimensions of the media have been determined.

onloadstart.description: Occurs when Internet Explorer begins looking for media data.

onmousedown.description: Fires when the user clicks the object with either mouse button.

onmousemove.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse over the object.

onmouseout.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer outside the boundaries of the object.

onmouseover.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer into the object.

onmouseup.description: Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is over the object.

onplay.description: Occurs when the play method is requested.

onplaying.description: Occurs when the audio or video has started playing.

onprogress.description: Occurs to indicate progress while downloading media data.

onratechange.description: Occurs when the playback rate is increased or decreased.

onreset.description: Fires when the user resets a form.

onscroll.description: Fires when the user repositions the scroll box in the scroll bar on the object.

onseeked.description: Occurs when the seek operation ends.

onseeking.description: Occurs when the current playback position is moved.

onselect.description: Fires when the current selection changes.

onstalled.description: Occurs when the download has stopped.

onsuspend.description: Occurs if the load operation has been intentionally halted.

ontimeupdate.description: Occurs to indicate the current playback position.

onvolumechange.description: Occurs when the volume is changed, or playback is muted or unmuted.

onwaiting.description: Occurs when playback stops because the next frame of a video resource is not available.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

slot.description: Returns the value of element's slot content attribute. Can be set to change it.

Attr.description: A DOM element's attribute as an object. In most DOM methods, you will probably directly retrieve the attribute as a string (e.g., Element.getAttribute(), but certain functions (e.g., Element.getAttributeNode()) or means of iterating give Attr types.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

baseURI.description: Returns node's node document's document base URL.

isConnected.description: Returns true if node is connected and false otherwise.

nodeName.description: Returns a string appropriate for the type of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINED_BY.description: Set when other is a descendant of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINS.description: Set when other is an ancestor of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

Document.description: Any web page loaded in the browser and serves as an entry point into the web page's content, which is the DOM tree.

URL.description: Sets or gets the URL for the current document.

body.description: Specifies the beginning and end of the document body.

charset.description: Gets or sets the character set used to encode the object.

compatMode.description: Gets a value that indicates whether standards-compliant mode is switched on for the object.

cookie.description:
Returns the HTTP cookies that apply to the Document. If there are no cookies or cookies can't be applied to this resource, the empty string will be returned.

Can be set, to add a new cookie to the element's set of HTTP cookies.

If the contents are sandboxed into a unique origin (e.g. in an iframe with the sandbox attribute), a "SecurityError" DOMException will be thrown on getting and setting.

currentScript.description:
Returns the script element, or the SVG script element, that is currently executing, as long as the element represents a classic script. In the case of reentrant script execution, returns the one that most recently started executing amongst those that have not yet finished executing.

Returns null if the Document is not currently executing a script or SVG script element (e.g., because the running script is an event handler, or a timeout), or if the currently executing script or SVG script element represents a module script.

designMode.description: Sets or gets a value that indicates whether the document can be edited.

dir.description: Sets or retrieves a value that indicates the reading order of the object.

doctype.description: Gets an object representing the document type declaration associated with the current document.

documentElement.description: Gets a reference to the root node of the document.

domain.description: Sets or gets the security domain of the document.

embeds.description: Retrieves a collection of all embed objects in the document.

forms.description: Retrieves a collection, in source order, of all form objects in the document.

items.description: A <form> element in the DOM; it allows access to and in some cases modification of aspects of the form, as well as access to its component elements.

fullscreenEnabled.description: Returns true if document has the ability to display elements fullscreen and fullscreen is supported, or false otherwise.

images.description: Retrieves a collection, in source order, of img objects in the document.

implementation.description: Gets the implementation object of the current document.

inputEncoding.description: Returns the character encoding used to create the webpage that is loaded into the document object.

lastModified.description: Gets the date that the page was last modified, if the page supplies one.

links.description: Retrieves a collection of all a objects that specify the href property and all area objects in the document.

location.description: Contains information about the current URL.

onreadystatechange.description: Fires when the state of the object has changed.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

plugins.description: Return an HTMLCollection of the embed elements in the Document.

readyState.description: Retrieves a value that indicates the current state of the object.

referrer.description: Gets the URL of the location that referred the user to the current page.

scripts.description: Retrieves a collection of all script objects in the document.

title.description: Contains the title of the document.

HTMLAnchorElement.description: Hyperlink elements and provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement object interface that they inherit from) for manipulating the layout and presentation of such elements.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

HTMLElement.description: Any HTML element. Some elements directly implement this interface, while others implement it via an interface that inherits it.

attributes.description: A collection of Attr objects. Objects inside a NamedNodeMap are not in any particular order, unlike NodeList, although they may be accessed by an index as in an array.

classList.description: Allows for manipulation of element's class content attribute as a set of whitespace-separated tokens through a DOMTokenList object.

className.description: Returns the value of element's class content attribute. Can be set to change it.

id.description: Returns the value of element's id content attribute. Can be set to change it.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

shadowRoot.description: Returns element's shadow root, if any, and if shadow root's mode is "open", and null otherwise.

slot.description: Returns the value of element's slot content attribute. Can be set to change it.

baseURI.description: Returns node's node document's document base URL.

isConnected.description: Returns true if node is connected and false otherwise.

nodeName.description: Returns a string appropriate for the type of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINED_BY.description: Set when other is a descendant of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINS.description: Set when other is an ancestor of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

nextElementSibling.description: Returns the first following sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

previousElementSibling.description: Returns the first preceding sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

firstElementChild.description: Returns the first child that is an element, and null otherwise.

lastElementChild.description: Returns the last child that is an element, and null otherwise.

style.description: An object that is a CSS declaration block, and exposes style information and various style-related methods and properties.

onabort.description: Fires when the user aborts the download.

onblur.description: Fires when the object loses the input focus.

oncanplay.description: Occurs when playback is possible, but would require further buffering.

onchange.description: Fires when the contents of the object or selection have changed.

onclick.description: Fires when the user clicks the left mouse button on the object

oncontextmenu.description: Fires when the user clicks the right mouse button in the client area, opening the context menu.

ondblclick.description: Fires when the user double-clicks the object.

ondrag.description: Fires on the source object continuously during a drag operation.

ondragend.description: Fires on the source object when the user releases the mouse at the close of a drag operation.

ondragenter.description: Fires on the target element when the user drags the object to a valid drop target.

ondragleave.description: Fires on the target object when the user moves the mouse out of a valid drop target during a drag operation.

ondragover.description: Fires on the target element continuously while the user drags the object over a valid drop target.

ondragstart.description: Fires on the source object when the user starts to drag a text selection or selected object.

ondurationchange.description: Occurs when the duration attribute is updated.

onemptied.description: Occurs when the media element is reset to its initial state.

onended.description: Occurs when the end of playback is reached.

onerror.description: Fires when an error occurs during object loading.

onfocus.description: Fires when the object receives focus.

onkeydown.description: Fires when the user presses a key.

onkeypress.description: Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key.

onkeyup.description: Fires when the user releases a key.

onload.description: Fires immediately after the browser loads the object.

onloadeddata.description: Occurs when media data is loaded at the current playback position.

onloadedmetadata.description: Occurs when the duration and dimensions of the media have been determined.

onloadstart.description: Occurs when Internet Explorer begins looking for media data.

onmousedown.description: Fires when the user clicks the object with either mouse button.

onmousemove.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse over the object.

onmouseout.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer outside the boundaries of the object.

onmouseover.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer into the object.

onmouseup.description: Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is over the object.

onplay.description: Occurs when the play method is requested.

onplaying.description: Occurs when the audio or video has started playing.

onprogress.description: Occurs to indicate progress while downloading media data.

onratechange.description: Occurs when the playback rate is increased or decreased.

onreset.description: Fires when the user resets a form.

onscroll.description: Fires when the user repositions the scroll box in the scroll bar on the object.

onseeked.description: Occurs when the seek operation ends.

onseeking.description: Occurs when the current playback position is moved.

onselect.description: Fires when the current selection changes.

onstalled.description: Occurs when the download has stopped.

onsuspend.description: Occurs if the load operation has been intentionally halted.

ontimeupdate.description: Occurs to indicate the current playback position.

onvolumechange.description: Occurs when the volume is changed, or playback is muted or unmuted.

onwaiting.description: Occurs when playback stops because the next frame of a video resource is not available.

Node.description: Node is an interface from which a number of DOM API object types inherit. It allows those types to be treated similarly; for example, inheriting the same set of methods, or being tested in the same way.

baseURI.description: Returns node's node document's document base URL.

isConnected.description: Returns true if node is connected and false otherwise.

nodeName.description: Returns a string appropriate for the type of node.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINED_BY.description: Set when other is a descendant of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINS.description: Set when other is an ancestor of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

firstElementChild.description: Returns the first child that is an element, and null otherwise.

lastElementChild.description: Returns the last child that is an element, and null otherwise.

DOMStringMap.description: Used by the dataset HTML attribute to represent data for custom attributes added to elements.

CSSStyleSheet.description: A single CSS style sheet. It inherits properties and methods from its parent, StyleSheet.

cssRules.description: A CSSRuleList is an (indirect-modify only) array-like object containing an ordered collection of CSSRule objects.

rules.description: A CSSRuleList is an (indirect-modify only) array-like object containing an ordered collection of CSSRule objects.

CSSRule.description: A single CSS rule. There are several types of rules, listed in the Type constants section below.

ProcessingInstruction.description: A processing instruction embeds application-specific instructions in XML which can be ignored by other applications that don't recognize them.

requiredExtensions.description: The SVGStringList defines a list of DOMString objects.

systemLanguage.description: The SVGStringList defines a list of DOMString objects.

SVGAnimatedLength.description: Used for attributes of basic type <length> which can be animated.

SVGLength.description: Correspond to the <length> basic data type.

SVGAnimatedTransformList.description: Used for attributes which take a list of numbers and which can be animated.

SVGTransformList.description: The SVGTransformList defines a list of SVGTransform objects.

SVGElement.description: All of the SVG DOM interfaces that correspond directly to elements in the SVG language derive from the SVGElement interface.

className.description: Returns the value of element's class content attribute. Can be set to change it.

attributes.description: A collection of Attr objects. Objects inside a NamedNodeMap are not in any particular order, unlike NodeList, although they may be accessed by an index as in an array.

classList.description: Allows for manipulation of element's class content attribute as a set of whitespace-separated tokens through a DOMTokenList object.

id.description: Returns the value of element's id content attribute. Can be set to change it.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

shadowRoot.description: Returns element's shadow root, if any, and if shadow root's mode is "open", and null otherwise.

slot.description: Returns the value of element's slot content attribute. Can be set to change it.

baseURI.description: Returns node's node document's document base URL.

isConnected.description: Returns true if node is connected and false otherwise.

nodeName.description: Returns a string appropriate for the type of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINED_BY.description: Set when other is a descendant of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINS.description: Set when other is an ancestor of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

nextElementSibling.description: Returns the first following sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

previousElementSibling.description: Returns the first preceding sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

firstElementChild.description: Returns the first child that is an element, and null otherwise.

lastElementChild.description: Returns the last child that is an element, and null otherwise.

style.description: An object that is a CSS declaration block, and exposes style information and various style-related methods and properties.

onabort.description: Fires when the user aborts the download.

onblur.description: Fires when the object loses the input focus.

oncanplay.description: Occurs when playback is possible, but would require further buffering.

onchange.description: Fires when the contents of the object or selection have changed.

onclick.description: Fires when the user clicks the left mouse button on the object

oncontextmenu.description: Fires when the user clicks the right mouse button in the client area, opening the context menu.

ondblclick.description: Fires when the user double-clicks the object.

ondrag.description: Fires on the source object continuously during a drag operation.

ondragend.description: Fires on the source object when the user releases the mouse at the close of a drag operation.

ondragenter.description: Fires on the target element when the user drags the object to a valid drop target.

ondragleave.description: Fires on the target object when the user moves the mouse out of a valid drop target during a drag operation.

ondragover.description: Fires on the target element continuously while the user drags the object over a valid drop target.

ondragstart.description: Fires on the source object when the user starts to drag a text selection or selected object.

ondurationchange.description: Occurs when the duration attribute is updated.

onemptied.description: Occurs when the media element is reset to its initial state.

onended.description: Occurs when the end of playback is reached.

onerror.description: Fires when an error occurs during object loading.

onfocus.description: Fires when the object receives focus.

onkeydown.description: Fires when the user presses a key.

onkeypress.description: Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key.

onkeyup.description: Fires when the user releases a key.

onload.description: Fires immediately after the browser loads the object.

onloadeddata.description: Occurs when media data is loaded at the current playback position.

onloadedmetadata.description: Occurs when the duration and dimensions of the media have been determined.

onloadstart.description: Occurs when Internet Explorer begins looking for media data.

onmousedown.description: Fires when the user clicks the object with either mouse button.

onmousemove.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse over the object.

onmouseout.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer outside the boundaries of the object.

onmouseover.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer into the object.

onmouseup.description: Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is over the object.

onplay.description: Occurs when the play method is requested.

onplaying.description: Occurs when the audio or video has started playing.

onprogress.description: Occurs to indicate progress while downloading media data.

onratechange.description: Occurs when the playback rate is increased or decreased.

onreset.description: Fires when the user resets a form.

onscroll.description: Fires when the user repositions the scroll box in the scroll bar on the object.

onseeked.description: Occurs when the seek operation ends.

onseeking.description: Occurs when the current playback position is moved.

onselect.description: Fires when the current selection changes.

onstalled.description: Occurs when the download has stopped.

onsuspend.description: Occurs if the load operation has been intentionally halted.

ontimeupdate.description: Occurs to indicate the current playback position.

onvolumechange.description: Occurs when the volume is changed, or playback is muted or unmuted.

onwaiting.description: Occurs when playback stops because the next frame of a video resource is not available.

requiredExtensions.description: The SVGStringList defines a list of DOMString objects.

systemLanguage.description: The SVGStringList defines a list of DOMString objects.

SVGAnimatedString.description: The SVGAnimatedString interface represents string attributes which can be animated from each SVG declaration. You need to create SVG attribute before doing anything else, everything should be declared inside this.

SVGAnimatedPreserveAspectRatio.description: Used for attributes of type SVGPreserveAspectRatio which can be animated.

SVGPreserveAspectRatio.description: Corresponds to the preserveAspectRatio attribute, which is available for some of SVG's elements.

SVGAnimatedRect.description: Used for attributes of basic SVGRect which can be animated.

Window.description: A window containing a DOM document; the document property points to the DOM document loaded in that window.

Navigator.description: The state and the identity of the user agent. It allows scripts to query it and to register themselves to carry on some activities.

mimeTypes.description: Returns an array of MimeType instances, each of which contains information about a supported browser plugins. This object is returned by NavigatorPlugins.mimeTypes.

plugins.description: Used to store a list of Plugin objects describing the available plugins; it's returned by the window.navigator.plugins property. The PluginArray is not a JavaScript array, but has the length property and supports accessing individual items using bracket notation (plugins[2]), as well as via item(index) and namedItem("name") methods.

^[0-9]+$.description: Provides information about a browser plugin.

VRDisplay.description: This WebVR API interface represents any VR device supported by this API. It includes generic information such as device IDs and descriptions, as well as methods for starting to present a VR scene, retrieving eye parameters and display capabilities, and other important functionality.

VRDisplayCapabilities.description: This WebVR API interface describes the capabilities of a VRDisplay — its features can be used to perform VR device capability tests, for example can it return position information.

sittingToStandingTransform.description:
A typed array of 32-bit float values. The contents are initialized to 0. If the requested number
of bytes could not be allocated an exception is raised.

Geolocation.description: An object able to programmatically obtain the position of the device. It gives Web content access to the location of the device. This allows a Web site or app to offer customized results based on the user's location.

MediaDevices.description: Provides access to connected media input devices like cameras and microphones, as well as screen sharing. In essence, it lets you obtain access to any hardware source of media data.

ServiceWorkerContainer.description: The ServiceWorkerContainer interface of the ServiceWorker API provides an object representing the service worker as an overall unit in the network ecosystem, including facilities to register, unregister and update service workers, and access the state of service workers and their registrations.

ServiceWorker.description: This ServiceWorker API interface provides a reference to a service worker. Multiple browsing contexts (e.g. pages, workers, etc.) can be associated with the same service worker, each through a unique ServiceWorker object.

Promise<ServiceWorkerRegistration>.description: Represents the completion of an asynchronous operation

MimeType.description: Provides contains information about a MIME type associated with a particular plugin. NavigatorPlugins.mimeTypes returns an array of this object.

enabledPlugin.description: Returns the Plugin object that implements this MIME type.

suffixes.description: Returns the MIME type's typical file extensions, in a comma-separated list.

Event.description: An event which takes place in the DOM.

bubbles.description: Returns true or false depending on how event was initialized. True if event goes through its target's ancestors in reverse tree order, and false otherwise.

cancelable.description: Returns true or false depending on how event was initialized. Its return value does not always carry meaning, but true can indicate that part of the operation during which event was dispatched, can be canceled by invoking the preventDefault() method.

composed.description: Returns true or false depending on how event was initialized. True if event invokes listeners past a ShadowRoot node that is the root of its target, and false otherwise.

currentTarget.description: Returns the object whose event listener's callback is currently being invoked.

defaultPrevented.description: Returns true if preventDefault() was invoked successfully to indicate cancelation, and false otherwise.

eventPhase.description: Returns the event's phase, which is one of NONE, CAPTURING_PHASE, AT_TARGET, and BUBBLING_PHASE.

isTrusted.description: Returns true if event was dispatched by the user agent, and false otherwise.

target.description: Returns the object to which event is dispatched (its target).

timeStamp.description: Returns the event's timestamp as the number of milliseconds measured relative to the time origin.

type.description: Returns the type of event, e.g. "click", "hashchange", or "submit".

EventTarget.description: EventTarget is a DOM interface implemented by objects that can receive events and may have listeners for them.

History.description: Allows manipulation of the browser session history, that is the pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in.

Location.description: The location (URL) of the object it is linked to. Changes done on it are reflected on the object it relates to. Both the Document and Window interface have such a linked Location, accessible via Document.location and Window.location respectively.

ancestorOrigins.description: Returns a DOMStringList object listing the origins of the ancestor browsing contexts, from the parent browsing context to the top-level browsing context.

hash.description:
Returns the Location object's URL's fragment (includes leading "#" if non-empty).

Can be set, to navigate to the same URL with a changed fragment (ignores leading "#").

host.description:
Returns the Location object's URL's host and port (if different from the default port for the scheme).

Can be set, to navigate to the same URL with a changed host and port.

hostname.description:
Returns the Location object's URL's host.

Can be set, to navigate to the same URL with a changed host.

href.description:
Returns the Location object's URL.

Can be set, to navigate to the given URL.

origin.description: Returns the Location object's URL's origin.

pathname.description:
Returns the Location object's URL's path.

Can be set, to navigate to the same URL with a changed path.

port.description:
Returns the Location object's URL's port.

Can be set, to navigate to the same URL with a changed port.

protocol.description:
Returns the Location object's URL's scheme.

Can be set, to navigate to the same URL with a changed scheme.

search.description:
Returns the Location object's URL's query (includes leading "?" if non-empty).

Can be set, to navigate to the same URL with a changed query (ignores leading "?").

Screen.description: A screen, usually the one on which the current window is being rendered, and is obtained using window.screen.

SpeechSynthesis.description: This Web Speech API interface is the controller interface for the speech service; this can be used to retrieve information about the synthesis voices available on the device, start and pause speech, and other commands besides.

Storage.description: This Web Storage API interface provides access to a particular domain's session or local storage. It allows, for example, the addition, modification, or deletion of stored data items.

length.description: Returns the number of key/value pairs currently present in the list associated with the object.

Crypto.description: Basic cryptography features available in the current context. It allows access to a cryptographically strong random number generator and to cryptographic primitives.

SubtleCrypto.description: This Web Crypto API interface provides a number of low-level cryptographic functions. It is accessed via the Crypto.subtle properties available in a window context (via Window.crypto).

IDBFactory.description: In the following code snippet, we make a request to open a database, and include handlers for the success and error cases. For a full working example, see our To-do Notifications app (view example live.)

Performance.description: Provides access to performance-related information for the current page. It's part of the High Resolution Time API, but is enhanced by the Performance Timeline API, the Navigation Timing API, the User Timing API, and the Resource Timing API.

PerformanceNavigation.description: The legacy PerformanceNavigation interface represents information about how the navigation to the current document was done.

PerformanceTiming.description: A legacy interface kept for backwards compatibility and contains properties that offer performance timing information for various events which occur during the loading and use of the current page. You get a PerformanceTiming object describing your page using the window.performance.timing property.

src.description: Sets or retrieves a URL to be loaded by the object.

width.description: Sets or retrieves the width of the object.

HTMLImageElement.description: Provides special properties and methods for manipulating elements.

alt.description: Sets or retrieves a text alternative to the graphic.

complete.description: Retrieves whether the object is fully loaded.

height.description: Sets or retrieves the height of the object.

isMap.description: Sets or retrieves whether the image is a server-side image map.

naturalHeight.description: The original height of the image resource before sizing.

naturalWidth.description: The original width of the image resource before sizing.

src.description: The address or URL of the a media resource that is to be considered.

useMap.description: Sets or retrieves the URL, often with a bookmark extension (#name), to use as a client-side image map.

width.description: Sets or retrieves the width of the object.

attributes.description: A collection of Attr objects. Objects inside a NamedNodeMap are not in any particular order, unlike NodeList, although they may be accessed by an index as in an array.

classList.description: Allows for manipulation of element's class content attribute as a set of whitespace-separated tokens through a DOMTokenList object.

className.description: Returns the value of element's class content attribute. Can be set to change it.

id.description: Returns the value of element's id content attribute. Can be set to change it.

ownerDocument.description: Returns the node document. Returns null for documents.

shadowRoot.description: Returns element's shadow root, if any, and if shadow root's mode is "open", and null otherwise.

slot.description: Returns the value of element's slot content attribute. Can be set to change it.

baseURI.description: Returns node's node document's document base URL.

isConnected.description: Returns true if node is connected and false otherwise.

nodeName.description: Returns a string appropriate for the type of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINED_BY.description: Set when other is a descendant of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINS.description: Set when other is an ancestor of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

nextElementSibling.description: Returns the first following sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

previousElementSibling.description: Returns the first preceding sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

firstElementChild.description: Returns the first child that is an element, and null otherwise.

lastElementChild.description: Returns the last child that is an element, and null otherwise.

style.description: An object that is a CSS declaration block, and exposes style information and various style-related methods and properties.

onabort.description: Fires when the user aborts the download.

onblur.description: Fires when the object loses the input focus.

oncanplay.description: Occurs when playback is possible, but would require further buffering.

onchange.description: Fires when the contents of the object or selection have changed.

onclick.description: Fires when the user clicks the left mouse button on the object

oncontextmenu.description: Fires when the user clicks the right mouse button in the client area, opening the context menu.

ondblclick.description: Fires when the user double-clicks the object.

ondrag.description: Fires on the source object continuously during a drag operation.

ondragend.description: Fires on the source object when the user releases the mouse at the close of a drag operation.

ondragenter.description: Fires on the target element when the user drags the object to a valid drop target.

ondragleave.description: Fires on the target object when the user moves the mouse out of a valid drop target during a drag operation.

ondragover.description: Fires on the target element continuously while the user drags the object over a valid drop target.

ondragstart.description: Fires on the source object when the user starts to drag a text selection or selected object.

ondurationchange.description: Occurs when the duration attribute is updated.

onemptied.description: Occurs when the media element is reset to its initial state.

onended.description: Occurs when the end of playback is reached.

onerror.description: Fires when an error occurs during object loading.

onfocus.description: Fires when the object receives focus.

onkeydown.description: Fires when the user presses a key.

onkeypress.description: Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key.

onkeyup.description: Fires when the user releases a key.

onload.description: Fires immediately after the browser loads the object.

onloadeddata.description: Occurs when media data is loaded at the current playback position.

onloadedmetadata.description: Occurs when the duration and dimensions of the media have been determined.

onloadstart.description: Occurs when Internet Explorer begins looking for media data.

onmousedown.description: Fires when the user clicks the object with either mouse button.

onmousemove.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse over the object.

onmouseout.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer outside the boundaries of the object.

onmouseover.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer into the object.

onmouseup.description: Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is over the object.

onplay.description: Occurs when the play method is requested.

onplaying.description: Occurs when the audio or video has started playing.

onprogress.description: Occurs to indicate progress while downloading media data.

onratechange.description: Occurs when the playback rate is increased or decreased.

onreset.description: Fires when the user resets a form.

onscroll.description: Fires when the user repositions the scroll box in the scroll bar on the object.

onseeked.description: Occurs when the seek operation ends.

onseeking.description: Occurs when the current playback position is moved.

onselect.description: Fires when the current selection changes.

onstalled.description: Occurs when the download has stopped.

onsuspend.description: Occurs if the load operation has been intentionally halted.

ontimeupdate.description: Occurs to indicate the current playback position.

onvolumechange.description: Occurs when the volume is changed, or playback is muted or unmuted.

onwaiting.description: Occurs when playback stops because the next frame of a video resource is not available.

DOMImplementation.description: An object providing methods which are not dependent on any particular document. Such an object is returned by the Document.implementation property.

HTMLAreaElement.description: Provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular object HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of <area> elements.

alt.description: Sets or retrieves a text alternative to the graphic.

coords.description: Sets or retrieves the coordinates of the object.

relList.description: A set of space-separated tokens. Such a set is returned by Element.classList, HTMLLinkElement.relList, HTMLAnchorElement.relList, HTMLAreaElement.relList, HTMLIframeElement.sandbox, or HTMLOutputElement.htmlFor. It is indexed beginning with 0 as with JavaScript Array objects. DOMTokenList is always case-sensitive.

shape.description: Sets or retrieves the shape of the object.

target.description: Sets or retrieves the window or frame at which to target content.

lastElementChild.description: Returns the last child that is an element, and null otherwise.

name.description: Returns the name of the function. Function names are read-only and can not be changed.

inputMode.description: Hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents

is.description: Specify that a standard HTML element should behave like a defined custom built-in element

aria-activedescendant.description: Identifies the currently active element when DOM focus is on a composite widget, textbox, group, or application.

aria-atomic.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

aria-autocomplete.description:
Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for an input and specifies how predictions would be
presented if they are made.

aria-busy.description: Indicates an element is being modified and that assistive technologies MAY want to wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.

aria-checked.description: Indicates the current "checked" state of checkboxes, radio buttons, and other widgets.

aria-colcount.description: Defines the total number of columns in a table, grid, or treegrid.

aria-colindex.description: Defines an element's column index or position with respect to the total number of columns within a table, grid, or treegrid.

aria-colspan.description: Defines the number of columns spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

aria-controls.description: Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element.

aria-current.description: Indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

aria-describedby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object.

aria-details.description: Identifies the element that provides a detailed, extended description for the object.

aria-disabled.description: Indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable.

aria-dropeffect.description: Indicates what functions can be performed when a dragged object is released on the drop target.

aria-errormessage.description: Identifies the element that provides an error message for the object.

aria-expanded.description: Indicates whether the element, or another grouping element it controls, is currently expanded or collapsed.

aria-flowto.description:
Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion,
allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order.

aria-grabbed.description: Indicates an element's "grabbed" state in a drag-and-drop operation.

aria-haspopup.description: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

aria-hidden.description: Indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API.

aria-invalid.description: Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application.

aria-keyshortcuts.description: Indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.

aria-label.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element.

aria-labelledby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.

aria-level.description: Defines the hierarchical level of an element within a structure.

aria-live.description: Indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

aria-modal.description: Indicates whether an element is modal when displayed.

aria-multiline.description: Indicates whether a text box accepts multiple lines of input or only a single line.

aria-multiselectable.description: Indicates that the user may select more than one item from the current selectable descendants.

aria-orientation.description: Indicates whether the element's orientation is horizontal, vertical, or unknown/ambiguous.

aria-owns.description:
Identifies an element (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child relationship
between DOM elements where the DOM hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship.

aria-placeholder.description:
Defines a short hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.
A hint could be a sample value or a brief description of the expected format.

aria-posinset.description: Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.

aria-pressed.description: Indicates the current "pressed" state of toggle buttons.

aria-readonly.description: Indicates that the element is not editable, but is otherwise operable.

aria-relevant.description: Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified.

aria-required.description: Indicates that user input is required on the element before a form may be submitted.

aria-roledescription.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.

aria-rowcount.description: Defines the total number of rows in a table, grid, or treegrid.

aria-rowindex.description: Defines an element's row index or position with respect to the total number of rows within a table, grid, or treegrid.

aria-rowspan.description: Defines the number of rows spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

aria-selected.description: Indicates the current "selected" state of various widgets.

aria-setsize.description: Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.

aria-sort.description: Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.

aria-valuemax.description: Defines the maximum allowed value for a range widget.

aria-valuemin.description: Defines the minimum allowed value for a range widget.

aria-valuenow.description: Defines the current value for a range widget.

aria-valuetext.description: Defines the human readable text alternative of aria-valuenow for a range widget.

inputMode.description: Hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents

HTMLButtonElement.description: Provides properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating <button> elements.

form.description: Retrieves a reference to the form that the object is embedded in.

anyOf.description: A <form> element in the DOM; it allows access to and in some cases modification of aspects of the form, as well as access to its component elements.

formAction.description: Overrides the action attribute (where the data on a form is sent) on the parent form element.

formEnctype.description: Used to override the encoding (formEnctype attribute) specified on the form element.

formMethod.description: Overrides the submit method attribute previously specified on a form element.

formNoValidate.description: Overrides any validation or required attributes on a form or form elements to allow it to be submitted without validation. This can be used to create a "save draft"-type submit option.

formTarget.description: Overrides the target attribute on a form element.

name.description: Sets or retrieves the name of the object.

type.description: Gets the classification and default behavior of the button.

validationMessage.description: Returns the error message that would be displayed if the user submits the form, or an empty string if no error message. It also triggers the standard error message, such as "this is a required field". The result is that the user sees validation messages without actually submitting.

validity.description: Returns a  ValidityState object that represents the validity states of an element.

value.description: Sets or retrieves the default or selected value of the control.

willValidate.description: Returns whether an element will successfully validate based on forms validation rules and constraints.

isConnected.description: Returns true if node is connected and false otherwise.

nodeName.description: Returns a string appropriate for the type of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINED_BY.description: Set when other is a descendant of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_CONTAINS.description: Set when other is an ancestor of node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_DISCONNECTED.description: Set when node and other are not in the same tree.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_FOLLOWING.description: Set when other is following node.

DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRECEDING.description: Set when other is preceding node.

nextElementSibling.description: Returns the first following sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

previousElementSibling.description: Returns the first preceding sibling that is an element, and null otherwise.

firstElementChild.description: Returns the first child that is an element, and null otherwise.

lastElementChild.description: Returns the last child that is an element, and null otherwise.

style.description: An object that is a CSS declaration block, and exposes style information and various style-related methods and properties.

onabort.description: Fires when the user aborts the download.

onblur.description: Fires when the object loses the input focus.

oncanplay.description: Occurs when playback is possible, but would require further buffering.

onchange.description: Fires when the contents of the object or selection have changed.

onclick.description: Fires when the user clicks the left mouse button on the object

oncontextmenu.description: Fires when the user clicks the right mouse button in the client area, opening the context menu.

ondblclick.description: Fires when the user double-clicks the object.

ondrag.description: Fires on the source object continuously during a drag operation.

ondragend.description: Fires on the source object when the user releases the mouse at the close of a drag operation.

ondragenter.description: Fires on the target element when the user drags the object to a valid drop target.

ondragleave.description: Fires on the target object when the user moves the mouse out of a valid drop target during a drag operation.

ondragover.description: Fires on the target element continuously while the user drags the object over a valid drop target.

ondragstart.description: Fires on the source object when the user starts to drag a text selection or selected object.

ondurationchange.description: Occurs when the duration attribute is updated.

onemptied.description: Occurs when the media element is reset to its initial state.

onended.description: Occurs when the end of playback is reached.

onerror.description: Fires when an error occurs during object loading.

onfocus.description: Fires when the object receives focus.

onkeydown.description: Fires when the user presses a key.

onkeypress.description: Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key.

onkeyup.description: Fires when the user releases a key.

onload.description: Fires immediately after the browser loads the object.

onloadeddata.description: Occurs when media data is loaded at the current playback position.

onloadedmetadata.description: Occurs when the duration and dimensions of the media have been determined.

onloadstart.description: Occurs when Internet Explorer begins looking for media data.

onmousedown.description: Fires when the user clicks the object with either mouse button.

onmousemove.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse over the object.

onmouseout.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer outside the boundaries of the object.

onmouseover.description: Fires when the user moves the mouse pointer into the object.

onmouseup.description: Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is over the object.

onplay.description: Occurs when the play method is requested.

onplaying.description: Occurs when the audio or video has started playing.

onprogress.description: Occurs to indicate progress while downloading media data.

onratechange.description: Occurs when the playback rate is increased or decreased.

onreset.description: Fires when the user resets a form.

onscroll.description: Fires when the user repositions the scroll box in the scroll bar on the object.

onseeked.description: Occurs when the seek operation ends.

onseeking.description: Occurs when the current playback position is moved.

onselect.description: Fires when the current selection changes.

onstalled.description: Occurs when the download has stopped.

onsuspend.description: Occurs if the load operation has been intentionally halted.

ontimeupdate.description: Occurs to indicate the current playback position.

onvolumechange.description: Occurs when the volume is changed, or playback is muted or unmuted.

onwaiting.description: Occurs when playback stops because the next frame of a video resource is not available.

ValidityState.description: The validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation. Together, they help explain why an element's value fails to validate, if it's not valid.
